intro: Mougeotia mollis, commonly known as the slender green alga, is a freshwater species belonging to the order Coleochaetales. It is characterized by its filamentous structure, consisting of unbranched, elongated cells that form a continuous chain. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, and instead exhibits a simple thallus with a single layer of cells. It often grows in shallow, still waters and is commonly found in ponds and lakes. Mougeotia mollis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
